= process by which humans, or objects are or become contaminated, ◄ as a result of contagious diseases or conditions, unlawful activities, or contact with what has been contaminated, ► which often results in their inability of being used or participating in social and religious activities, until this state is reversed through prescribed rituals and procedures
= causative action by which humans cause other humans or animals to move to a location relatively close to the location in focus
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y
= an individual, nation, or land that is affected by efforts from others to arouse an emotion of shame in them ◄ by words or actions

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= action by which someone speaks insulting words to someone else, ◄ out of a sense of superiority, ► intending to bring public shame upon that person

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which someone speaks insulting words to someone else, ◄ out of a sense of superiority, ► intending to bring public shame upon that person
= state in which humans have been morally and/or ethically contaminated by evil behavior

= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

= causative action by which someone causes someone else to take off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which brings shame on that person and to those who stand in a close relation to them
= state in which humans, animals, or objects are regarded by the law as having been contaminated, ► as a result of which they cannot participate in social and religious activities
= state in which humans are considered unclean because of a flow of blood or contact with a corpse

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= causative action by which deities cause a group of people to divide itself and move into various directions

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= something that causes humans, animals, or objects to be regarded by the law as having been contaminated, as a result of which anything that touches them may become contaminated as well; ► humans, animals, and objects that are unclean cannot participate in social and religious activities, until this state is reversed through prescribed rituals and procedures
= causative action by which humans or deities bring dishonor on other humans

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= silvery white metal; ► used, together with copper, for the production of bronze
= a strong, hard magnetic silvery grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence
= a heavy bluish grey soft metal, ≈ associated with heavy weight

= a construction ◄ made of hardened clay or of bricks ► and used for the smelting of ore or the firing of ceramic ware; ≈ often used figuratively to denote a prolonged period of hardship; also associated with times of testing and trial
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes

= causative action by which humans gathering material objects from different sources to keep for themselves or put in storage
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= a strong, hard magnetic silvery grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence
= a heavy bluish grey soft metal, ≈ associated with heavy weight
= silvery white metal; ► used, together with copper, for the production of bronze

= a construction ◄ made of hardened clay or of bricks ► and used for the smelting of ore or the firing of ceramic ware; ≈ often used figuratively to denote a prolonged period of hardship; also associated with times of testing and trial

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals to come together as a group for a common purpose
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= process by which a solid substance is turned into a liquid ◄ by exposing it to extreme heat

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a referent to a female participant addressed in a discourse

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= causative process by which people cause an area or object to be free from dirt, contamination and everything else that is not supposed to be present
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= water that has fallen as rain

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= action by which humans or deities express their intense anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior, ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible
= action by which humans devise a plan concerning other humans ► with the intention to harm that person
= male person speaking on behalf of a deity

= the largest of the great cats, often being about 2.8 meters from nose to tip of tail, standing as high as 1 meter (3 feet 3 inches) at the shoulder; pale yellowish brown in color; around the neck and shoulders of adult males grows a mane that is darker than the rest of their fur; ◄ Panthera leo; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression and strength
= action by which animals, humans, or deities produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion; ≈ associated with aggression, but also with suffering

Node.gloss: to tear to pieces|to maul|to mangle
Node.definition: = action by which a person or animal is cut up and killed with one's claws and/or teeth ► for food or in order to enlarge one's territory; ≈ associated with terrifying and deadly viciousness
literally: what is torn apart; hence: = slain victim of a carnivorous animal; ≈ associated with a violent death, bloodshed, and frequently used as a metaphor for victims of warfare

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= objects that are considered valuable to have
= state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and worthy of appreciation and respect

= woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= action by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans with which they have a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich themselves in one way or another
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior
= causative action by which humans (or deities by human hands) cause land, buildings, or other objects to be unfit for religious use ◄ usually by unlawful behavior
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= a relationship linking two or more individuals or groups
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= something that is accessible to ordinary people without preceding ritual
= state in which humans recognize the difference between entities on the basis of one or more of their characterteristics and avoid what does not meet the standard
= a relationship linking two or more individuals or groups
= state in which humans, animals, or objects are regarded by the law as having been contaminated, ► as a result of which they cannot participate in social and religious activities
= state in which people, animals, or objects are considered free from contamination, ► as a result of which the people can interact socially with others and the objects can be put to normal use

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= causative action by which humans or deities bring dishonor on other humans
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

= wild, four footed, predatory canine; light brown fur, similar to jackal, but much bigger; ◄ Canis lupus; ► commonly prey on flocks; ≈ regarded as ravenous and fierce; symbol of roaming, opportunistic, dangerous, fierce, and clever banditry

Node.gloss: to tear to pieces|to maul|to mangle
Node.definition: = action by which a person or animal is cut up and killed with one's claws and/or teeth ► for food or in order to enlarge one's territory; ≈ associated with terrifying and deadly viciousness

literally: to pour out blood; hence: = to wound or kill an animate being
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts

Node.gloss: to destroy a life > to kill people
Node.definition: literally: to destroy a life; hence: = action by which someone causes another person to die a violent death

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= pattern of actions by which someone makes an effort to get personal gain; ≈ with a negative connotation, of unjust gain
= possessions accumulated through advantageous transactions, in which part of the income can be kept for oneself, mostly achieved in an unjust way
= male person speaking on behalf of a deity

Node.gloss: to cover|to coat|to plaster|to smear|to paint|to overlay
Node.definition: = process by which a wall is coated with some material ► to protect or decorate its surface

= lime mixed with water; ► painted on walls to make them white and cover ugly rough surfaces; it does not strengthen a structure but only beautifies it; ≈ for that reason it is often associated with efforts to make something appear different from what it actually is

Node.gloss: to receive as a vision|to have a vision
Node.definition: = process by which humans perceive something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue

= action by which humans communicate with the spirit world using a variety of means such as inspecting the liver of animals, shaking arrows, consulting teraphim, or casting lots; ≈ usually regarded as an evil practice that is to be condemned; responsibility of a prophet or king
literally: falsehood; hence: = things that cannot be trusted

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force
= action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility
= person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God
= causative action by which humans cause hardship to other humans

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker classes within the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the widows, the fatherless, and other people who are poor
= practices that conform to the laws of God
= action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

Node.gloss: to build a wall|to repair a wall
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone builds or repairs a wall, often made of natural stones; ≈ such a wall is sometimes used to denote integrity, which can be negatively affected by sin

= a continuous vertical structure, usually made of natural stones, that encloses or divides an area of land; ≈ associated with security; in some cases used figuratively to denote integrity, which can be negatively affected by sin

= large hole in a wall, hedge, or in the ground; ► made with the purpose of entering through those holes or of making the area within it vulnerable; ≈ to have a town with a breached wall is also regarded as a deep humiliation

Node.gloss: for the sake of|for the benefit of
Node.definition: = relation denoting that someone performs a certain event for the benefit of someone or something else

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for
literally: to pout our (one's) anger; hence: = action by which deities give full vent to their anger by punishing the offender
= action by which humans or deities express their intense anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior, ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= literally: to finish; hence: = causative action by which humans and deities cause (other) humans and objects to completely disappear from existance
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
